titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York City Labor Chorus Records WAG.361
titlestmt.author: Amy C. Vo

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:47:09 -0400.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: New York City Labor Chorus Records

physdesc.extent: in 1 half manuscript box and 2 oversize folders.

did.abstract: The New York City Labor Chorus, with 75 members representing over 20 local unions and District Councils, was founded in 1991. Its music focuses on the message of workers' history and their struggles for social and economic justice. This collection contains posters, programs, and CDs from the choral organization, representing a sample of the celebrations, programming, and events that they organize. There are also notes on concepts, lyrics, and music for the musical theater piece entitled "Soul of the City."
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains posters, programs, and CDs from the New York City Labor Chorus. There are also notes on concepts, lyrics, and music for the musical theater piece entitled "Soul of the City."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Jeffrey Vogel, July 2018. The accession number associated with this gift is 2019.003.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The New York City Labor Chorus, with 75 members representing over 20 local unions and District Councils, was founded in 1991. Its music focuses on the message of workers' history and their struggles for social and economic justice.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; New York City Labor Chorus Records; WAG 361; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Loose items were placed in new acid-free folders. Born-digital materials were identified and physically inventoried, but not forensically imaged. New York University Libraries follow professional standards and best practices when imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity and authenticity of the content.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Jeffrey Vogel, the creator of this collection, were relinquished and transferred to the public domain in July 2018 by Jeffrey Vogel. These materials are governed by a Creative Commons CC0 license, which permits publication and reproduction of materials accompanied by full attribution. See, https://creativecommons.org/licenses/
